meta.name: Analytics Dashboard Design System
meta.source_reference: Dashboard screenshot provided by user (modern analytics SaaS UI)
meta.purpose: High-level design and style guide so AI and humans can recreate the same look & feel across this project.

design_principles.clarity_over_complexity: Always prefer clear hierarchy, generous whitespace, and easily scannable information. Avoid heavy borders and noisy decoration.
design_principles.comfortably_dense_data: The interface should show a lot of information, but never feel cramped. Use tight component layouts inside cards, but keep card-to-card spacing generous.
design_principles.soft_contrast: Use a dark sidebar and light content surface with soft grays instead of pure black/white. Contrast comes from typography weight and color accents more than from heavy borders.
design_principles.primary_actions_pop: Primary actions use a saturated blue pill/button and stand out clearly against the neutral background. Secondary actions are quiet and outlined/text-only.
design_principles.card_as_canvas: Most content lives inside cards on a light shell. Cards group related information with consistent padding, subtle shadows, and rounded corners.
design_principles.friendly_data_visualization: Numbers and statuses should feel approachable: rounded shapes, soft color accents, and simple micro-interactions (hover, focus).
design_principles.consistent_rhythm: All spacing is drawn from a small, harmonious scale (4/8px steps). Align content to a grid so vertical and horizontal rhythms feel deliberate.
design_principles.subtle_branding: The primary blue and avatar accents provide personality, but the overall palette remains neutral to let the data be the hero.

content_shell.description: Main white panel centered on a light gray background. The shadow is subtle; the shell should feel like a floating sheet of paper.

primary.description: Used for main CTAs, active indicators, and key highlights.

accent.description: Used sparingly in illustrations, badges, and avatar accents to keep the interface lively.

usage_guidelines.page_background: Use neutral.background for everything outside the main content shell.
usage_guidelines.card_background: Use neutral.surface; avoid colored card backgrounds except for small stat pills or tags.
usage_guidelines.text: Use neutral.text_strong for key numbers and titles, text_default for standard body, and text_muted for supporting labels or meta info.
usage_guidelines.sidebar: Use neutral.sidebar_bg for the main sidebar, with text_on_dark and icon_muted for labels and icons. The active item gets a primary-colored left indicator.
usage_guidelines.status_text: Use semantic.success.base for positive numbers and semantic.danger.base for negative values. Pair with small + or - prefixes.
usage_guidelines.borders: Use neutral.border_subtle for card outlines only when necessary; prefer shadow and elevation over heavy borders.
usage_guidelines.hover_states: Use row_hover for hover on rows and list items. For primary buttons, move from primary.base to primary.hover.

page_title.description: Used for greetings like 'Hey there, Brian Ford!'.

data_number_large.description: Key KPI numbers in the top stat cards.

usage_guidelines.shell: Use 2xl for the main white content shell.
usage_guidelines.cards: Use xl for primary cards and metrics cards.
usage_guidelines.table_rows: Rows remain mostly square; apply md radius on hover if they become clickable.
usage_guidelines.chips_and_badges: Use pill for rounded tags and metric pills.
usage_guidelines.buttons: Use lg to create soft rounded rectangles.

shadow-elevation-1.usage: Small elements like dropdowns or simple cards.

shadow-elevation-2.usage: Main content shell and prominent cards.

shadow-elevation-3.usage: Modal dialogs or surfaces that should sit clearly above the page.

iconography.style: simple 1px or 1.5px stroke icons, rounded corners, no filled heavy glyphs.
iconography.usage: Icons support text labels and never replace them in navigation.

borders.description: Borders are used sparingly; prefer soft background fills and shadows instead of thick outlines.

main_panel.description: Main panel scrolls independently from the fixed sidebar.

top_bar.description: Breadcrumbs and greeting text on the left, contextual actions (Edit, Add item, overflow) on the right.

content_sections.name: kpi_row
content_sections.description: Three side-by-side stat cards, each describing a tool (Slack, Sketch, MailChimp) with KPI and status.

content_sections.name: main_plus_sidebar
content_sections.description: Below KPI row, a two-column layout: wide main column (~70%) with transactions table and chart, right column (~30%) with a promo/CTA card.

Sidebar.description: Dark vertical bar containing the user identity and all navigation. Text is light with a slightly bluish tint; active item has a bright blue indicator.

SidebarUserProfile.description: Appears at top of sidebar; gives the app a personal, welcoming touch.

Breadcrumbs.description: Compact breadcrumb above page title, e.g., Home / Settings / General.

PageHeader.description: Greeting line and supporting copy under breadcrumbs.

primary.description: Used for main CTAs like 'Add item' or 'Let's Proceed'.

IconButton.description: Circular or softly rounded icon button used for overflow menus (three dots).

KpiStatCard.description: Compact card showing a channel (Slack, Sketch, MailChimp) with its current revenue and a small trend indicator.

StatDelta.description: Small line under each KPI; consistently uses + or - signs.

Table.description: Transactions table with clear columns: Name (with avatar), Amount (colored +/-), Account (with small account chip and chevron).

Avatar.description: Colorful circular avatars used both in the sidebar profile and in the transactions table.

CTAAsideCard.description: Right-hand promotional card such as 'Kickstart Your Mobile Application' with a blue primary button and playful line illustration.

Pagination.description: Lightweight pagination under tables, no heavy background.

AdvancedGraphicPlaceholder.description: Container for charts or advanced graphs below the transactions table. Charts should follow the same color rules: primary blue for main series, grays for axes, soft fills.
